note.text: Although ethnic, regional, and religious loyalties are important, the extended family is the main social group. Large families are very common, and land is supposed to stay within families.

The family itself is very hierarchical. Men are seen as deserving more respect than women, and older people deserve more respect than younger ones. As a result, the eldest male is typically the head of the family.
Identity has much to do with "biraderi," which is translated variously as kinship, patrilineage, and caste. Biraderi determines where people live, their political allegiances, and who they marry.
